Event.name: Statement
Event.definition:
<def-root>This frame contains verbs and nouns that communicate the act of a <fen>Speaker</fen> to address a <fen>Message</fen> to some <fen>Addressee</fen> using language. Instead of (or in addition to) a <fen>Speaker</fen>, a <fen>Medium</fen> may also be mentioned. Likewise, a <fen>Topic</fen> may be stated instead of a <fen>Message</fen>. A number of the words can be used performatively, such as <m>declare</m> and <m>insist</m>.
<ex><fex name="Speaker">I</fex> now <t>declare</t> <fex name="Message">you</fex> <fex name="Message">members of this Society</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Speaker">She</fex> <t>said</t> <fex name="Message">that I would be late</fex> .</ex>
<ex>The <t>announcement</t> <fex name="Top">about raffle winners</fex> came <fex name="Medium">across the loudspeaker</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Speaker
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity that produces the <fen>Message</fen> (whether spoken or written). It is normally expressed as the External Argument of predicative uses of the <t>target </t> word, or as the Genitive modifier of the noun. <ex><fex name="Spkr">Evelyn</fex> <t>spoke</t> feelingly about what happened.</ex> <ex><fex name="Spkr">Evelyn</fex> made a persuasive <t>statement</t>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Spkr">Evelyn's</fex> <t>statement</t> was quite persuasive.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Addressee
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Addressee</fen> is the person to whom the <fen>Message</fen> is communicated. When this FE is expressed, it often appears in a prepositional phrase introduced by "to", or as a direct object. <ex>Evelyn <t>reported</t> <fex name="Add">to me</fex> about what happened.</ex> <ex>Evelyn <t>spoke</t> <fex name="Add">to me</fex> about what happened.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Message
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Message</fen> is the FE that identifies the content of what the <fen>Speaker</fen> is communicating to the <fen>Addressee</fen>. It can be expressed as a clause or as a noun phrase. <ex>Evelyn <t>said</t> <fex name="Msg">that she was not ready to leave</fex>.</ex> <ex>Evelyn <t>explained</t> <fex name="Msg">that she had seen him before</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Topic
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the <fen>Message</fen> pertains. It is normally expressed as a PP Complement headed by "about", but in some cases it can appear as a direct object. <ex>Evelyn <t>spoke</t> candidly <fex name="Top">about her past</fex>.</ex> <ex>The teacher <t>mentioned</t> <fex name="Top">the recent campus incidents</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Manner</fen> of performing an action.</def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>An act whereby the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes a <fen>Message</fen>. <ex>Bilio <t>commented</t> on the paper <fex name="Mns">by scrawling innumerable post-its in a range of colors and sticking them all over it</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Internal_cause
Arg.definition: <def-root>The emotional or physical state of the <fen>Speaker</fen> that leads to their speaking. <ex>He <t>wrote</t> <fex name="ICause">in bitterness</fex> of the treatment the Malloreans had given him.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Medium
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to transmit the statement. <ex>Kim <t>preached</t> to me <fex name="Medium">over the phone</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition: <def-root>The state of the <fen>Speaker</fen> during the <fen>Message</fen>. <ex>Let's see if you <t>say</t> that <fex name="Dep">sober</fex>!</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Message</fen> is made.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>The FE specifies the location where the <fen>Message</fen> takes place. <ex>In some <t>remarks</t> <fex name="Place">at the National Press Club</fex>, Mr. Keating said he would make a better prime minister tha nMr. Hawke.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Occasion
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Occasion</fen> is the reason a public <fen>Message</fen> is given. <ex>The <fex name="Occasion">New Year</fex> <t>address</t> was well received.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Particular_iteration
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE indicate that the particular <fen>Message</fen> event referred to is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. Most expressions of <fen>Particular_iteration</fen> indicate which instance of the series is being referred to.
<ex>A further biography Shadowland by William Arnold, published in 1978, <t>asserted</t> <fex name="par">for the first time</fex> that Farmer had been the subject of a transorbital lobotomy</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Communicative_force
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE indicates the <fen>Communicative_force</fen> or authority with which the <fen>Message</fen> is expressed (often denoted by words such as "officially," "formally," "technically," etc.). </def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE selects some gradable attribute and modifies the expected value for it.</def-root>

Arg.name: Group
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Group</fen> of <fen>Speaker</fen>s or <fen>Medium</fen>s within which the <fen>Message</fen> is made. <ex>Much would be achieved if these were more <fex name="Group">widely</fex> <t>acknowledged</t>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Event_description
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE describes the <fen>Message</fen> event.</def-root>

Arg.name: Frequency
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time.</def-root>

Arg.name: Iterations
Arg.definition: <def-root>The FE <fex name="Iterations">Iterations</fex> is used for expressions that indicate the number of times an event or state (of the kind denoted by the target in its clause) has taken place or held.</def-root>

Arg.name: Containing_event
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies an event during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> produces the <fen>Message</fen>. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: add.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: say as a further remark.

lexUnit.name: address.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: speak or write to

lexUnit.name: admission.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a confession.

lexUnit.name: allegation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of alleging

lexUnit.name: allege.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: claim that someone has done something wrong, typically without proof.

lexUnit.name: announce.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make a formal public declaration about a fact, occurrence, or intention.

lexUnit.name: announcement.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of announcing

lexUnit.name: assert.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: declare, or state clearly

lexUnit.name: assertion.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of asserting

lexUnit.name: attest.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: declare that something exists or is the case.

lexUnit.name: aver.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: state or assert to be the case.

lexUnit.name: avow.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: assert or confess openly

lexUnit.name: caution.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: say something as a warning

lexUnit.name: claim.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an assertion of the truth of something

lexUnit.name: claim.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: assert that something is the case.

lexUnit.name: comment.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a remark expressing an opinion or reaction

lexUnit.name: comment.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: express an opinion or reaction.

lexUnit.name: concession.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a usually reluctant acknowledgment of a fact

lexUnit.name: conjecture.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an opinion or conclusion based on incomplete information.

lexUnit.name: conjecture.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: form a conjecture.

lexUnit.name: contend.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: assert.

lexUnit.name: contention.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an assertion.

lexUnit.name: declaration.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a formal or explicit statement or announcement

lexUnit.name: declare.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: announce solemnly or officially; make clearly known.

lexUnit.name: denial.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the action of denying something.

lexUnit.name: exclaim.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cry out suddenly, especially in surprise, anger, or pain.

lexUnit.name: exclamation.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: exclamation is a derivative of exclaim

lexUnit.name: explain.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make (something) clear by describing it in more detail.

lexUnit.name: gloat.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: contemplate one's own success or another's misfortune with smugness or malignant pleasure.

lexUnit.name: insist.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: demand or state forcefully, without accepting refusal or contradiction.

lexUnit.name: maintain.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: assert something to be the case.

lexUnit.name: mention.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a reference to someone or something.

lexUnit.name: mention.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to make reference to something

lexUnit.name: preach.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: deliver a religious address to an assembled group of people.

lexUnit.name: proclaim.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: announce officially or publicly.

lexUnit.name: proclamation.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: proclamation is a derivative of proclaim

lexUnit.name: profess.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: claim that one has (a quality or feeling).

lexUnit.name: pronouncement.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: pronouncement is a derivative of pronounce

lexUnit.name: proposal.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a plan or suggestion

lexUnit.name: propose.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: put forward (an idea or plan) for consideration by others.

lexUnit.name: proposition.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an option for future action

lexUnit.name: reaffirm.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: state again as a fact; assert again strongly.

lexUnit.name: recount.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: give an account of something.

lexUnit.name: reiterate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: say something again or repeatedly.

lexUnit.name: relate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: give an account of.

lexUnit.name: remark.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a comment

lexUnit.name: remark.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: say as a comment; mention.

lexUnit.name: report.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an account given of a matter after investigation or consideration

lexUnit.name: report.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: give a spoken or written account of something.

lexUnit.name: say.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: utter words so as to convey information, an opinion, an instruction, etc.

lexUnit.name: speak.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: say something

lexUnit.name: state.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: express definitely or clearly in speech or writing

lexUnit.name: statement.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a definite or clear expression of something in speech or writing

lexUnit.name: suggest.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: put forward for consideration.

lexUnit.name: talk.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: speak in order to give information or express ideas or feelings; converse or communicate by speech.

lexUnit.name: write.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to record a message in writing

lexUnit.name: insistence.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: forceful statement

lexUnit.name: explanation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of explaining, making something clear

lexUnit.name: venture.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to offer a remark at the risk of being rebuffed or censured for it

lexUnit.name: hazard.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: venture to say

lexUnit.name: pout.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to say something in a manner expressing annoyance or disappointment

lexUnit.name: smirk.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: smile in an irritatingly smug or silly way.

lexUnit.name: confirm.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: give assurance of the validity of something.

lexUnit.name: avowal.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an open declaration or confession.

lexUnit.name: acknowledge.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: accept or admit the existence or truth of.

lexUnit.name: acknowledgment.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the action of acknowledging.

lexUnit.name: note.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: express an observation, often as a side remark.

lexUnit.name: observe.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: say; remark

lexUnit.name: refute.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: deny (a statement or accusation).

lexUnit.name: describe.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: give a detailed account in words of.

lexUnit.name: promulgation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a formal proclomation

lexUnit.name: message.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a communication that addresses the speaker's or authors feelings

lexUnit.name: detail.v
lexUnit.definition: Fn: explain in detail

lexUnit.name: tell.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: communicate a story, tale, etc (support only)

lexUnit.name: allow.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: concede.

lexUnit.name: caution.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: A statement intended to convey potential danger or risk.

lexUnit.name: be like.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: To state either out loud or internally.

lexUnit.name: challenge.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: (rare) state in direct or implicit contradition to preceding discourse.

lexUnit.name: pronounce.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to make a serious statement, to announce
